name: Self-Understanding Axiom
intent: Specify when a reflexive semantic system understands itself in a structurally rigorous sense.
constraints: The system is reflexive if evaluation via self-models (Π ∘ ι ∘ M) agrees with direct evaluation (Π ∘ Φ ∘ δ) on a stable subset of C.
System dynamics must depend on self-evaluation: ċ \= F(c, Π(ι(M(c)))).
There exists an invariant, compact subset K ⊆ C such that the flow generated by F has at least one fixed point c\* ∈ K.
The restricted self-model M|\_A on the attractor A (which may be {c\*} or a more complex set) is injective or retains the essential semantic identity of the system.
